arts.ttl: Stevenage boss not happy with the performance at Charlton
arts.sum: "It means winning your duels and not allowing people to hold the ball up in the corner for two minutes [as Charlton did to close out the game]. He said: "We lost too many first contact and second balls, we didn't win our duels and ultimately, in the first half, we didn't take our chances when they came .

arts.ttl: The lowdown on Charlton Athletic 2 Stevenage 0 - Matty Godden proving there is life after Alfie May
arts.sum: Charlton Athletic: Maynard-Brewer, Ramsay, Jones, Gillesphey, Edwards, Small, Docherty, Coventry, Berry (Gilbert 88), Campbell (Kanu 88), Godden (Leaburn 88). The timings of the goal were brutal for Stevenage – a matter of minutes before the interval and then the same after the restart as Luke Berry finished coolly after Tyreece Campbell’s shot cannoned back off the woodwork.

arts.ttl: Snoozing Stevenage not early risers this week with deserved loss to Charlton
arts.sum: Former Boro favourite Matty Godden put the home side in front on 44 minutes with Luke Berry adding to the lead three minutes after half-time, the game eventually finishing 2-0. The switches for Boro included a debut for Hanlan and eventually Edwards on 74 minutes, but Charlton should have added to their lead by then.

arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic boss Nathan Jones: Matty Godden is a top, top frontman
arts.sum: Jones said: “It is the movement (for his goal), the awareness and then bang…you’ve still got to finish it. Matty Godden earned effusive praise off Charlton Athletic manager Nathan Jones after his performance in today’s 2-0 win over Stevenage.

arts.ttl: Charlton ease past Stevenage to move into the top six
Moments deny memories - Stevenage lose 1-0 in Vertu Trophy to Blues - player ratings
arts.sum: I'd actually convinced myself that this was going to be Stevenage's year but in the end an 82nd minute winner from Jay Stansfield sent Birmingham City in the semi-finals of the Vertu Trophy with a 1-0 win. A delicious through ball to create a chance for Jake Young and a couple of typical Dan Sweeney moments as he strode out of defence.

arts.ttl: Stevenage boss says new signing ‘desperate’ to get going against Charlton Athletic
arts.sum: Alex Revell has said his side are looking forward to introducing their new signings for the first time against Charlton Athletic tomorrow at The Valley. “We look forward to getting Hanlan in the squad,” said Revell.

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough loanee determined to pay back Charlton Athletic’s patience in winter transfer window
arts.sum: I feel like I’m good enough to play at Boro in the Championship – hopefully I can prove that even more on this loan and do well here. There were a few people at Boro, the manager being one, who still wanted to keep me there – being in the position where they are going for the play-offs – but I was a big pusher for going somewhere I’m going to play football.

arts.ttl: Kayne Ramsay on being bed-bound after knee injury to making strong return for Charlton Athletic
arts.sum: Kayne Ramsay has admitted he feared the worst when he was forced off with a knee injury in Charlton’s draw with Stockport in October. “I was devastated,” Ramsay told the South London Press, reflecting on his injury.

arts.ttl: Preview: Charlton Athletic vs. Stevenage - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Saturday's League One clash between Charlton Athletic and Stevenage, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.
